Class FileWriteConnector

All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent, IWriteConnector
public class FileWriteConnector
extends AbstractStreamWriteConnector

A Write Connector that write data to a file (or stdout if the filename property is not set).

Author:
OA3 Core Team

Method Detail

getOutputStream

protected java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream()
Creates a file output stream. If filename is not set, the System.out (console stream) is returned. If the file already exists, it is renamed to moveExistingFileTo (if the property is set). If the file already exists and the addTimestampToMovedFile is set to true, the new filename (moveExistingFileTo) will be extended by a timestamp.

Specified by:
getOutputStream in class AbstractStreamWriteConnector
Returns:
an output stream this connector will write to
